intro: Mentha hirsuta var. spicata, commonly known as hairy mint or spicata mint, is a variant of the mint plant characterized by its hairy foliage and strong aromatic properties. It is a perennial herb native to temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with square stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, tubular, and clustered in whorls, often producing a distinctive minty fragrance. This variety is often used in traditional herbal medicine and as a flavoring agent due to its essential oils.
